name: G. Bonnema
comment info:
I notice that Manhattan, Tokyo, Nairobi, Los Angeles, Paris, and Brazil have consistently low rates not usually reaching unhealthy levels and usually below 25 micrograms per cubic meter. I notice that Kampala has fairly consistent rates that could be unhealthy with brief exceptions. I notice that Kuala Lumpur and San Fransisco have low rates of particulate pollution (San Fransisco usually below 25 micrograms per cubic meter, and Kuala Lumpur remaining below 50 micrograms per cubic meter) except for a brief spike when it was approximately 150 micrograms per cubic meter. Kampala is usually from 50 micrograms per cubic meter to 75 micrograms per cubic meter with a few outliers. New Delhi has exceptionally high levels starting at about 350 micrograms per cubic centimeter and forming a negative slope until the outliers at the end. Bejing starts with an average of 175 micrograms per cubic meter then dropping to about 25 micrograms per cubic meter before rising to 100 micrograms per cubic meter at the end. 
I wonder what causes the spikes in micrograms per cubic meter. Could it possibly be caused by fires, destruction of buildings resulting in particulate pollution? I wonder why the population of the countries isn't proportionate in many cases for especially in the case, of San Paolo, Tokyo, and Mexico City. 
A possible title could be "Air Pollution: Invisible Until It's Too Late".

name: Sam
comment info:
I notice that in San Francisco air pollution rates have dropped significantly. In late 2018, they were unhealthy range. In early 2019 and moving forward, air pollution rates dropped significantly. The air is now considered good with some yellow, meaning slightly higher air pollution.

I wonder why American cities have had lower/safer air pollution than most other cities around the world? What are we doing different in America to help lower air pollution? Is it because Americans are more environmentally concerned than people in other parts of the world?

I live 30 minutes outside of Manhattan and right outside of some major cities so air pollution is a topic brought up often. However, it is a great thing to see Manhattan has some of the cleanest air compared to most major cities. From November 2018 to November 2019, Manhattan was green/good with some yellow/higher air pollution. Compared to most major cities Manhattan has done a great job stopping air pollution.

"Air pollution and Major Cities"
